element.name: Royal Canal Way-Phib Locks by Kili or bust, Multi-cache (1.5/1.5)

center.font: Visit The Geocaching Ireland discussion forum HERE

element.long-description:
Cache Information:
***PLEASE NOTE THAT THERE IS A DANGEROUS DROP VERY CLOSE TO THE CACHE SITE SO CHILDREN SHOULD BE VERY CAREFULLY SUPERVISED***
This is a micro magnetic cache. You will need to bring a pen or pencil.
The coordinates above should bring you to a canal lock near the inner city suburb of Phibsboro. To find the final coordinates count the (mostly green but not all) numbered poles BETWEEN the lock and the Phibsboro bridge (also green). Call that number "A".
On your way toward the bridge the number on the sixth pole is what? Call that number "B".
The final coordinates are N53 21.A67 W006 16.B15
In recent years, Phibsboro has experienced a renaissance and house prices in the area have increased substantially. Moreover, private developers have secured planning permission to upgrade the existing Phibsboro Shopping Centre through a €75 million refurbishment. The area retains much of its original Victorian architecture, including terraces of red-brick houses and majestic churches, such as St. Peter's Church, as well as number of traditional Irish pubs such as O'Mahony's and The Hut. Recently, the government announced plans to close historic Mountjoy Prison in 2008 and redevelop the site, maintaining at least some of the original buildings. St Peter's Church's entrance displays a prominent skull and crossbones motif on a piece of masonry near the front gate.
The Royal Canal separates Phibsboro from Drumcondra, and the immediately adjacent neighbourhood of Glasnevin. There is a linear park along the canal, leading to the City Basin (also known as "Blessington St Basin"), which is a popular walking area for locals and visitors. This linear park is situated along the former trajectory of a spur from the Royal Canal.The ¾-mile branch originally ran south from below the 5th lock on the Royal's main line, under the North Circular Road by Blacquiere Bridge and along the east side of Phibsborough Road. Foster Aqueduct carried the canal over Phibsborough Road to the terminus, a large harbour at the Broadstone.
Phibsboro also contains one of the major teaching hospitals of Dublin, the Mater Misericordiae University Hospital, it is also in close proximity to the Children's Hospital, Temple Street. In early June 2006 the government announced plans to develop a National Children's Hospital on a site adjoining the Mater Hospital.
The Royal Canal
The towpath along the canal is now designated “The Royal Canal Way”. It is possible to walk or cycle from the 1st Dock in the centre of Dublin to the 40th lock and is being cleared further as restoration proceeds towards the Shannon and Longford. Signposts have been erected at each bridge between Clonsilla and Mullingar. Eventually these will be extended to cover the entire length of the canal
element.encoded-hints: You will probably have to take some steps. Low.

ul.li:
2010-05-23T19:00:00Z : Found it by tolmaion
What a beautiful and sunny day it was today - perfect for biking over to the Royal Canal and grabbing this cache. At first, I was not sure which poles to count exactly and got the coordinates wrong. It turns out that you should count *only* the green poles, none of the other, wooden ones. Then, the coordinates make sense and the cache is easy to get.
TFTC

2010-03-28T19:00:00Z : Found it by Lahtac
1st of a great day out today. TFTC SL

2010-03-28T19:00:00Z : Found it by OBCLAN
2nd attempts at this one. Did it in the wrong direction first time which was never going to work. 1st fin on a great day out. TFTC SL

2010-03-27T19:00:00Z : Found it by Toffee Man
Found the cache today with Blue Jay 59. TFTC Toffee Man #261

2010-03-27T19:00:00Z : Found it by Blue Jay 59
Found this easily today with Toffee Man. Only saw green numbered poles, but it gave us perfect co-ords [:D] TFTC Blue Jay 59 #261

wpt.name: GCZECQ
wpt.desc: Royal Canal Way-Phib Locks by Kili or bust, Multi-cache (1.5/1.5)
